title: Conversion Formula
text: Recall that the formula converting Celsius into Fahrenheit is $$F=\frac{9}{5} C+32$$, where C is the temperature in Celsius and F is the temperature in Fahrenheit.
speech: Recall that the formula converting Celsius into Fahrenheit is    f is equal to, 9 fifths   c, plus 32 , where C is the temperature in Celsius and F is the temperature in Fahrenheit.
pacedSpeech: Recall that the formula converting Celsius into Fahrenheit is     f is equal to, 9 fifths   c, plus 32
, where C is the temperature in Celsius and F is the temperature in Fahrenheit.

title: Applying the Conversion
text: To use the formula, all we need to do is substitute $$5$$ for the C, so we get the equation $$F=5\frac{9}{5}+32$$.
speech: To use the formula, all we need to do is substitute  5  for the C, so we get the equation    f, is equal to, 5 and 9 fifths, plus 32 .
pacedSpeech: To use the formula, all we need to do is substitute   5
for the C, so we get the equation     f, is equal to, 5 and 9 fifths, plus 32

subHints.title: Evaluating the Expression
subHints.text: To evaluate $$5\frac{9}{5}+32$$, we evaluate the multiplication first. What is $$5\frac{9}{5}$$?

subHints.title: Evaluating the Expression
subHints.text: Then, we evaluate $$9+32$$. What is this value?
